Monster storage
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher EVO Archive (PS2): Miscellaneous Q & A: Monster storage
By kudos on Friday, May 19, 2006 - 05:36 pm:

since i live in a different country, the game isn't released yet here. so i was just wondering if you can freeze the monsters and get it back alive (like MR2) or you have to let it retire first bhefore you freeze it (like MR4)? pls help me

By kilak on Friday, May 19, 2006 - 08:44 pm:

basically you seal the monster it becomes a saucer that can be used for combining. it can pass on stats based on its dna (1-8 after using all dna points it reverts to a newly born monster for combining purposes)

the saucer can also be used to revive the same monster but it will no longer gain stats after it reaches a certain age.

technically there is no death in evo

there is a bunch of info on aging in a thread above called aging monsters.
